revised_title: Investigating Harmonic Ratios in the Spectra of Gases
tldr: The author examines the spectra of various elements, including magnesium, sodium, copper, and barium, to investigate the presence of harmonic ratios in their spectral lines. The results show that the observed coincidences with harmonic ratios are fewer than expected, suggesting that the law of harmonic ratios may not be a true one.
